member.summary: This function creates a context using a specified device.
member.param: A pointer to a device.

member.returns: Returns a pointer to the new context (NULL on failure).
member.remarks: The attribute list can be NULL, or a zero terminated list of integer pairs composed of valid ALC attribute tokens and requested values.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALC.ProcessContext(OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALContext)
member.summary: This function tells a context to begin processing. When a context is suspended, changes in OpenAL state will be accepted but will not be processed. alcSuspendContext can be used to suspend a context, and then all the OpenAL state changes can be applied at once, followed by a call to alcProcessContext to apply all the state changes immediately. In some cases, this procedure may be more efficient than application of properties in a non-suspended state. In some implementations, process and suspend calls are each a NOP.
member.param: A pointer to the new context.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALC.SuspendContext(OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALContext)
member.summary: This function suspends processing on a specified context. When a context is suspended, changes in OpenAL state will be accepted but will not be processed. A typical use of alcSuspendContext would be to suspend a context, apply all the OpenAL state changes at once, and then call alcProcessContext to apply all the state changes at once. In some cases, this procedure may be more efficient than application of properties in a non-suspended state. In some implementations, process and suspend calls are each a NOP.
member.param: A pointer to the context to be suspended.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALC.GetStringPtr(OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALDevice,OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.AlcGetString)
member.summary: This strings related to the context.
member.remarks: ALC_DEFAULT_DEVICE_SPECIFIER will return the name of the default output device. ALC_CAPTURE_DEFAULT_DEVICE_SPECIFIER will return the name of the default capture device. ALC_DEVICE_SPECIFIER will return the name of the specified output device if a pointer is supplied, or will return a list of all available devices if a NULL device pointer is supplied. A list is a pointer to a series of strings separated by NULL characters, with the list terminated by two NULL characters. See Enumeration Extension for more details. ALC_CAPTURE_DEVICE_SPECIFIER will return the name of the specified capture device if a pointer is supplied, or will return a list of all available devices if a NULL device pointer is supplied. ALC_EXTENSIONS returns a list of available context extensions, with each extension separated by a space and the list terminated by a NULL character.
member.param: A pointer to the device to be queried.
An attribute to be retrieved: ALC_DEFAULT_DEVICE_SPECIFIER, ALC_CAPTURE_DEFAULT_DEVICE_SPECIFIER, ALC_DEVICE_SPECIFIER, ALC_CAPTURE_DEVICE_SPECIFIER, ALC_EXTENSIONS.
member.returns: A string containing the name of the Device.

member.summary: This strings related to the context.

ALC_DEVICE_SPECIFIER will return the name of the specified output device if a pointer is supplied, or will return a list of all available devices if a NULL device pointer is supplied. A list is a pointer to a series of strings separated by NULL characters, with the list terminated by two NULL characters. See Enumeration Extension for more details. ALC_CAPTURE_DEVICE_SPECIFIER will return the name of the specified capture device if a pointer is supplied, or will return a list of all available devices if a NULL device pointer is supplied. ALC_EXTENSIONS returns a list of available context extensions, with each extension separated by a space and the list terminated by a NULL character.
member.param: A pointer to the device to be queried.
An attribute to be retrieved: ALC_DEFAULT_DEVICE_SPECIFIER, ALC_CAPTURE_DEFAULT_DEVICE_SPECIFIER, ALC_DEVICE_SPECIFIER, ALC_CAPTURE_DEVICE_SPECIFIER, ALC_EXTENSIONS.
member.returns: A string containing the name of the Device.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALC.CaptureStart(OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALCaptureDevice)
member.summary: This function begins a capture operation.
member.remarks: alcCaptureStart will begin recording to an internal ring buffer of the size specified when opening the capture device. The application can then retrieve the number of samples currently available using the ALC_CAPTURE_SAPMPLES token with alcGetIntegerv. When the application determines that enough samples are available for processing, then it can obtain them with a call to alcCaptureSamples.
member.param: A pointer to a capture device.

member.summary: This function stops a capture operation.
member.param: A pointer to a capture device.

member.summary: This function completes a capture operation, and does not block.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.AlcContextAttributes.EfxMaxAuxiliarySends
member.summary: (EFX Extension) This Context property can be passed to OpenAL during Context creation (alcCreateContext) to request a maximum number of Auxiliary Sends desired on each Source. It is not guaranteed that the desired number of sends will be available, so an application should query this property after creating the context using alcGetIntergerv. Default: 2

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.AlcGetInteger.EfxMaxAuxiliarySends
member.summary: (EFX Extension) This Context property can be passed to OpenAL during Context creation (alcCreateContext) to request a maximum number of Auxiliary Sends desired on each Source. It is not guaranteed that the desired number of sends will be available, so an application should query this property after creating the context using alcGetIntergerv. Default: 2

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.AL.GetError
member.summary: Error support. Obtain the most recent error generated in the AL state machine. When an error is detected by AL, a flag is set and the error code is recorded. Further errors, if they occur, do not affect this recorded code. When alGetError is called, the code is returned and the flag is cleared, so that a further error will again record its code.
member.returns: The first error that occured. can be used with AL.GetString. Returns an Alenum representing the error state. When an OpenAL error occurs, the error state is set and will not be changed until the error state is retrieved using alGetError. Whenever alGetError is called, the error state is cleared and the last state (the current state when the call was made) is returned. To isolate error detection to a specific portion of code, alGetError should be called before the isolated section to clear the current error state.

member.returns: Returns the actual ALenum described by a string. Returns 0 if the string doesnt describe a valid OpenAL token.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.AL.SourcePlay(System.Int32,System.Int32*)
member.summary: This function plays a set of sources. The playing sources will have their state changed to ALSourceState.Playing. When called on a source which is already playing, the source will restart at the beginning. When the attached buffer(s) are done playing, the source will progress to the ALSourceState.Stopped state.
member.param: The number of sources to be played.
A pointer to an array of sources to be played.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.AL.SourceQueueBuffers(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32*)
member.summary: This function queues a set of buffers on a source. All buffers attached to a source will be played in sequence, and the number of processed buffers can be detected using AL.GetSource with parameter ALGetSourcei.BuffersProcessed. When first created, a source will be of type ALSourceType.Undetermined. A successful AL.SourceQueueBuffers call will change the source type to ALSourceType.Streaming.
member.param: The name of the source to queue buffers onto.
The number of buffers to be queued.
A pointer to an array of buffer names to be queued.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.AL.DopplerFactor(System.Single)
member.summary: AL.DopplerFactor is a simple scaling of source and listener velocities to exaggerate or deemphasize the Doppler (pitch) shift resulting from the calculation.
member.param: A negative value will result in an error, the command is then ignored. The default value is 1f. The current setting can be queried using AL.Get with parameter ALGetFloat.SpeedOfSound.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.AL.DopplerVelocity(System.Single)
member.summary: This function is deprecated and should not be used.
member.param: The default is 1.0f.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.AL.SpeedOfSound(System.Single)
member.summary: AL.SpeedOfSound allows the application to change the reference (propagation) speed used in the Doppler calculation. The source and listener velocities should be expressed in the same units as the speed of sound.
member.param: A negative or zero value will result in an error, and the command is ignored. Default: 343.3f (appropriate for velocity units of meters and air as the propagation medium). The current setting can be queried using AL.Get with parameter ALGetFloat.SpeedOfSound.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.AL.DistanceModel(OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALDistanceModel)
member.summary: This function selects the OpenAL distance model ALDistanceModel.InverseDistance, ALDistanceModel.InverseDistanceClamped, ALDistanceModel.LinearDistance, ALDistanceModel.LinearDistanceClamped, ALDistanceModel.ExponentDistance, ALDistanceModel.ExponentDistanceClamped, or ALDistanceModel.None. The default distance model in OpenAL is ALDistanceModel.InverseDistanceClamped.
member.remarks:
The ALDistanceModel .InverseDistance model works according to the following formula: gain = ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance / (ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance + ALSourcef.RolloffFactor * (distance ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance));
The ALDistanceModel .InverseDistanceClamped model works according to the following formula: distance = max(distance,ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance); distance = min(distance,ALSourcef.MaxDistance); gain = ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance / (ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance + ALSourcef.RolloffFactor * (distance ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance));
The ALDistanceModel.LinearDistance model works according to the following formula: distance = min(distance, ALSourcef.MaxDistance) // avoid negative gain gain = (1 ALSourcef.RolloffFactor * (distance ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance) / (ALSourcef.MaxDistance ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance))
The ALDistanceModel.LinearDistanceClamped model works according to the following formula: distance = max(distance, ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance) distance = min(distance, ALSourcef.MaxDistance) gain = (1 ALSourcef.RolloffFactor * (distance ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance) / (ALSourcef.MaxDistance ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance))
The ALDistanceModel.ExponentDistance model works according to the following formula: gain = (distance / ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance) ^ (- ALSourcef.RolloffFactor)
The ALDistanceModel.ExponentDistanceClamped model works according to the following formula: distance = max(distance, ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance) distance = min(distance, ALSourcef.MaxDistance) gain = (distance / ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance) ^ (- ALSourcef.RolloffFactor)
The ALDistanceModel.None model works according to the following formula: gain = 1f;.
member.param: The distance model to use.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALListenerf
member.summary: A list of valid 32-bit Float Listener/GetListener parameters.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALListenerf.Gain
member.summary: Indicate the gain (Volume amplification) applied. Type: float Range: [0.0f - ? ] A value of 1.0 means un-attenuated/unchanged. Each division by 2 equals an attenuation of -6dB. Each multiplicaton with 2 equals an amplification of +6dB. A value of 0.0f is interpreted as zero volume and the channel is effectively disabled.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALListenerf.EfxMetersPerUnit
member.summary: (EFX Extension) This setting is critical if Air Absorption effects are enabled because the amount of Air Absorption applied is directly related to the real-world distance between the Source and the Listener. centimeters 0.01f meters 1.0f kilometers 1000.0f Range [float.MinValue .. float.MaxValue] Default: 1.0f

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALListener3f
member.summary: A list of valid Math.Vector3 Listener/GetListener parameters.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALListener3f.Position
member.summary: Specify the current location in three dimensional space. OpenAL, like OpenGL, uses a right handed coordinate system, where in a frontal default view X (thumb) points right, Y points up (index finger), and Z points towards the viewer/camera (middle finger). To switch from a left handed coordinate system, flip the sign on the Z coordinate. Listener position is always in the world coordinate system.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALListener3f.Velocity
member.summary: Specify the current velocity in three dimensional space.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALListenerfv
member.summary: A list of valid float[] Listener/GetListener parameters.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALListenerfv.Orientation
member.summary: Indicate Listener orientation. Expects two Vector3, At followed by Up.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourcef
member.summary: A list of valid 32-bit Float Source/GetSource parameters.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance
member.summary: Source specific reference distance. Type: float Range: [0.0f - float.PositiveInfinity] At 0.0f, no distance attenuation occurs. Type: float Default: 1.0f.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourcef.MaxDistance
member.summary: Indicate distance above which Sources are not attenuated using the inverse clamped distance model. Default: float.PositiveInfinity Type: float Range: [0.0f - float.PositiveInfinity]

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourcef.RolloffFactor
member.summary: Source specific rolloff factor. Type: float Range: [0.0f - float.PositiveInfinity]

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourcef.Pitch
member.summary: Specify the pitch to be applied, either at Source, or on mixer results, at Listener. Range: [0.5f - 2.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourcef.Gain
member.summary: Indicate the gain (volume amplification) applied. Type: float. Range: [0.0f - ? ] A value of 1.0 means un-attenuated/unchanged. Each division by 2 equals an attenuation of -6dB. Each multiplicaton with 2 equals an amplification of +6dB. A value of 0.0f is meaningless with respect to a logarithmic scale; it is interpreted as zero volume - the channel is effectively disabled.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourcef.MinGain
member.summary: Indicate minimum Source attenuation. Type: float Range: [0.0f - 1.0f] (Logarthmic)

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourcef.MaxGain
member.summary: Indicate maximum Source attenuation. Type: float Range: [0.0f - 1.0f] (Logarthmic)

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourcef.ConeInnerAngle
member.summary: Directional Source, inner cone angle, in degrees. Range: [0-360] Default: 360

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourcef.ConeOuterAngle
member.summary: Directional Source, outer cone angle, in degrees. Range: [0-360] Default: 360

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourcef.ConeOuterGain
member.summary: Directional Source, outer cone gain. Default: 0.0f Range: [0.0f - 1.0] (Logarithmic)

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourcef.SecOffset
member.summary: The playback position, expressed in seconds.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourcef.EfxAirAbsorptionFactor
member.summary: (EFX Extension) This property is a multiplier on the amount of Air Absorption applied to the Source. The AL_AIR_ABSORPTION_FACTOR is multiplied by an internal Air Absorption Gain HF value of 0.994 (-0.05dB) per meter which represents normal atmospheric humidity and temperature. Range [0.0f .. 10.0f] Default: 0.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourcef.EfxRoomRolloffFactor
member.summary: (EFX Extension) This property is defined the same way as the Reverb Room Rolloff property: it is one of two methods available in the Effect Extension to attenuate the reflected sound (early reflections and reverberation) according to source-listener distance. Range [0.0f .. 10.0f] Default: 0.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourcef.EfxConeOuterGainHighFrequency
member.summary: (EFX Extension) A directed Source points in a specified direction. The Source sounds at full volume when the listener is directly in front of the source; it is attenuated as the listener circles the Source away from the front. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSource3f
member.summary: A list of valid Math.Vector3 Source/GetSource parameters.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSource3f.Position
member.summary: Specify the current location in three dimensional space. OpenAL, like OpenGL, uses a right handed coordinate system, where in a frontal default view X (thumb) points right, Y points up (index finger), and Z points towards the viewer/camera (middle finger). To switch from a left handed coordinate system, flip the sign on the Z coordinate. Listener position is always in the world coordinate system.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSource3f.Velocity
member.summary: Specify the current velocity in three dimensional space.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSource3f.Direction
member.summary: Specify the current direction vector.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourceb
member.summary: A list of valid 8-bit boolean Source/GetSource parameters.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourceb.SourceRelative
member.summary: Indicate that the Source has relative coordinates. Type: bool Range: [True, False]

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourceb.Looping
member.summary: Indicate whether the Source is looping. Type: bool Range: [True, False] Default: False.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourceb.EfxDirectFilterGainHighFrequencyAuto
member.summary: (EFX Extension) If this Source property is set to True, this Sources direct-path is automatically filtered according to the orientation of the source relative to the listener and the setting of the Source property Sourcef.ConeOuterGainHF. Type: bool Range [False, True] Default: True

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourceb.EfxAuxiliarySendFilterGainAuto
member.summary: (EFX Extension) If this Source property is set to True, the intensity of this Sources reflected sound is automatically attenuated according to source-listener distance and source directivity (as determined by the cone parameters). If it is False, the reflected sound is not attenuated according to distance and directivity. Type: bool Range [False, True] Default: True

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourceb.EfxAuxiliarySendFilterGainHighFrequencyAuto
member.summary: (EFX Extension) If this Source property is AL_TRUE (its default value), the intensity of this Sources reflected sound at high frequencies will be automatically attenuated according to the high-frequency source directivity as set by the Sourcef.ConeOuterGainHF property. If this property is AL_FALSE, the Sources reflected sound is not filtered at all according to the Sources directivity. Type: bool Range [False, True] Default: True

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourcei.EfxDirectFilter

member.summary: Sound sample's frequency, in units of hertz [Hz]. This is the number of samples per second. Half of the sample frequency marks the maximum significant frequency component.

member.summary: Bit depth of the buffer. Should be 8 or 16.

member.summary: Number of channels in buffer. > 1 is valid, but buffer wont be positioned when played. 1 for Mono, 2 for Stereo.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALGetBufferi.Size
member.summary: size of the Buffer in bytes.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat
member.summary: A list of valid 32-bit Float Effect/GetEffect parameters.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.ReverbDensity
member.summary: Reverb Modal Density controls the coloration of the late reverb. Lowering the value adds more coloration to the late reverb. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.ReverbDiffusion
member.summary: The Reverb Diffusion property controls the echo density in the reverberation decay. The default 1.0f provides the highest density. Reducing diffusion gives the reverberation a more "grainy" character that is especially noticeable with percussive sound sources. If you set a diffusion value of 0.0f, the later reverberation sounds like a succession of distinct echoes. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.ReverbGain
member.summary: The Reverb Gain property is the master volume control for the reflected sound - both early reflections and reverberation - that the reverb effect adds to all sound sources. Ranges from 1.0 (0db) (the maximum amount) to 0.0 (-100db) (no reflected sound at all) are accepted. Units: Linear gain Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.32f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.ReverbGainHF
member.summary: The Reverb Gain HF property further tweaks reflected sound by attenuating it at high frequencies. It controls a low-pass filter that applies globally to the reflected sound of all sound sources feeding the particular instance of the reverb effect. Ranges from 1.0f (0db) (no filter) to 0.0f (-100db) (virtually no reflected sound) are accepted. Units: Linear gain Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.89f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.ReverbDecayTime
member.summary: The Decay Time property sets the reverberation decay time. It ranges from 0.1f (typically a small room with very dead surfaces) to 20.0 (typically a large room with very live surfaces). Unit: Seconds Range [0.1f .. 20.0f] Default: 1.49f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.ReverbDecayHFRatio
member.summary: The Decay HF Ratio property sets the spectral quality of the Decay Time parameter. It is the ratio of high-frequency decay time relative to the time set by Decay Time.. Unit: linear multiplier Range [0.1f .. 2.0f] Default: 0.83f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.ReverbReflectionsGain
member.summary: The Reflections Gain property controls the overall amount of initial reflections relative to the Gain property. The value of Reflections Gain ranges from a maximum of 3.16f (+10 dB) to a minimum of 0.0f (-100 dB) (no initial reflections at all), and is corrected by the value of the Gain property. Unit: Linear gain Range [0.0f .. 3.16f] Default: 0.05f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.ReverbReflectionsDelay
member.summary: The Reflections Delay property is the amount of delay between the arrival time of the direct path from the source to the first reflection from the source. It ranges from 0 to 300 milliseconds. Unit: Seconds Range [0.0f .. 0.3f] Default: 0.007f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.ReverbLateReverbGain
member.summary: The Late Reverb Gain property controls the overall amount of later reverberation relative to the Gain property. The value of Late Reverb Gain ranges from a maximum of 10.0f (+20 dB) to a minimum of 0.0f (-100 dB) (no late reverberation at all). Unit: Linear gain Range [0.0f .. 10.0f] Default: 1.26f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.ReverbLateReverbDelay
member.summary: The Late Reverb Delay property defines the begin time of the late reverberation relative to the time of the initial reflection (the first of the early reflections). It ranges from 0 to 100 milliseconds. Unit: Seconds Range [0.0f .. 0.1f] Default: 0.011f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.ReverbAirAbsorptionGainHF
member.summary: The Air Absorption Gain HF property controls the distance-dependent attenuation at high frequencies caused by the propagation medium and applies to reflected sound only. Unit: Linear gain per meter Range [0.892f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.994f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.ReverbRoomRolloffFactor
member.summary: The Room Rolloff Factor property is one of two methods available to attenuate the reflected sound (containing both reflections and reverberation) according to source-listener distance. It's defined the same way as OpenAL's Rolloff Factor, but operates on reverb sound instead of direct-path sound. Unit: Linear multiplier Range [0.0f .. 10.0f] Default: 0.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.ChorusRate
member.summary: This property sets the modulation rate of the low-frequency oscillator that controls the delay time of the delayed signals. Unit: Hz Range [0.0f .. 10.0f] Default: 1.1f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.ChorusDepth
member.summary: This property controls the amount by which the delay time is modulated by the low-frequency oscillator. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.1f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.ChorusFeedback
member.summary: This property controls the amount of processed signal that is fed back to the input of the chorus effect. Negative values will reverse the phase of the feedback signal. At full magnitude the identical sample will repeat endlessly. Range [-1.0f .. +1.0f] Default: +0.25f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.ChorusDelay
member.summary: This property controls the average amount of time the sample is delayed before it is played back, and with feedback, the amount of time between iterations of the sample. Larger values lower the pitch. Unit: Seconds Range [0.0f .. 0.016f] Default: 0.016f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.DistortionEdge
member.summary: This property controls the shape of the distortion. The higher the value for Edge, the "dirtier" and "fuzzier" the effect. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.2f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.DistortionGain
member.summary: This property allows you to attenuate the distorted sound. Range [0.01f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.05f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.DistortionLowpassCutoff
member.summary: Input signals can have a low pass filter applied, to limit the amount of high frequency signal feeding into the distortion effect. Unit: Hz Range [80.0f .. 24000.0f] Default: 8000.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.DistortionEQCenter
member.summary: This property controls the frequency at which the post-distortion attenuation (Distortion Gain) is active. Unit: Hz Range [80.0f .. 24000.0f] Default: 3600.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.DistortionEQBandwidth
member.summary: This property controls the bandwidth of the post-distortion attenuation. Unit: Hz Range [80.0f .. 24000.0f] Default: 3600.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EchoDelay
member.summary: This property controls the delay between the original sound and the first "tap", or echo instance. Subsequently, the value for Echo Delay is used to determine the time delay between each "second tap" and the next "first tap". Unit: Seconds Range [0.0f .. 0.207f] Default: 0.1f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EchoLRDelay
member.summary: This property controls the delay between the "first tap" and the "second tap". Subsequently, the value for Echo LR Delay is used to determine the time delay between each "first tap" and the next "second tap". Unit: Seconds Range [0.0f .. 0.404f] Default: 0.1f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EchoDamping
member.summary: This property controls the amount of high frequency damping applied to each echo. As the sound is subsequently fed back for further echoes, damping results in an echo which progressively gets softer in tone as well as intensity. Range [0.0f .. 0.99f] Default: 0.5f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EchoFeedback
member.summary: This property controls the amount of feedback the output signal fed back into the input. Use this parameter to create "cascading" echoes. At full magnitude, the identical sample will repeat endlessly. Below full magnitude, the sample will repeat and fade. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.5f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EchoSpread
member.summary: This property controls how hard panned the individual echoes are. With a value of 1.0f, the first "tap" will be panned hard left, and the second "tap" hard right. 1.0f gives the opposite result and values near to 0.0f result in less emphasized panning. Range [-1.0f .. +1.0f] Default: -1.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.FlangerRate
member.summary: The number of times per second the low-frequency oscillator controlling the amount of delay repeats. Range [0.0f .. 10.0f] Default: 0.27f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.FlangerDepth
member.summary: The ratio by which the delay time is modulated by the low-frequency oscillator. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.FlangerFeedback
member.summary: This is the amount of the output signal level fed back into the effect's input. A negative value will reverse the phase of the feedback signal. Range [-1.0f .. +1.0f] Default: -0.5f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.FlangerDelay
member.summary: The average amount of time the sample is delayed before it is played back. When used with the Feedback property it's the amount of time between iterations of the sample. Unit: Seconds Range [0.0f .. 0.004f] Default: 0.002f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.FrequencyShifterFrequency
member.summary: This is the carrier frequency. For carrier frequencies below the audible range, the single sideband modulator may produce phaser effects, spatial effects or a slight pitch-shift. As the carrier frequency increases, the timbre of the sound is affected. Unit: Hz Range [0.0f .. 24000.0f] Default: 0.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.VocalMorpherRate
member.summary: This controls the frequency of the low-frequency oscillator used to morph between the two phoneme filters. Unit: Hz Range [0.0f .. 10.0f] Default: 1.41f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.RingModulatorFrequency
member.summary: This is the frequency of the carrier signal. If the carrier signal is slowly varying (less than 20 Hz), the result is a slow amplitude variation effect (tremolo). Unit: Hz Range [0.0f .. 8000.0f] Default: 440.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.RingModulatorHighpassCutoff
member.summary: This controls the cutoff frequency at which the input signal is high-pass filtered before being ring modulated. Unit: Hz Range [0.0f .. 24000.0f] Default: 800.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.AutowahAttackTime
member.summary: This property controls the time the filtering effect takes to sweep from minimum to maximum center frequency when it is triggered by input signal. Unit: Seconds Range [0.0001f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.06f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.AutowahReleaseTime
member.summary: This property controls the time the filtering effect takes to sweep from maximum back to base center frequency, when the input signal ends. Unit: Seconds Range [0.0001f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.06f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.AutowahResonance
member.summary: This property controls the resonant peak, sometimes known as emphasis or Q, of the auto-wah band-pass filter. Range [2.0f .. 1000.0f] Default: 1000.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.AutowahPeakGain
member.summary: This property controls the input signal level at which the band-pass filter will be fully opened. Range [0.00003f .. 31621.0f] Default: 11.22f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EqualizerLowGain
member.summary: This property controls amount of cut or boost on the low frequency range. Range [0.126f .. 7.943f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EqualizerLowCutoff
member.summary: This property controls the low frequency below which signal will be cut off. Unit: Hz Range [50.0f .. 800.0f] Default: 200.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EqualizerMid1Gain
member.summary: This property allows you to cut/boost signal on the "mid1" range. Range [0.126f .. 7.943f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EqualizerMid1Center
member.summary: This property sets the center frequency for the "mid1" range. Unit: Hz Range [200.0f .. 3000.0f] Default: 500.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EqualizerMid1Width
member.summary: This property controls the width of the "mid1" range. Range [0.01f .. 1.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EqualizerMid2Gain
member.summary: This property allows you to cut/boost signal on the "mid2" range. Range [0.126f .. 7.943f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EqualizerMid2Center
member.summary: This property sets the center frequency for the "mid2" range. Unit: Hz Range [1000.0f .. 8000.0f] Default: 3000.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EqualizerMid2Width
member.summary: This property controls the width of the "mid2" range. Range [0.01f .. 1.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EqualizerHighGain
member.summary: This property allows to cut/boost the signal at high frequencies. Range [0.126f .. 7.943f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EqualizerHighCutoff
member.summary: This property controls the high frequency above which signal will be cut off. Unit: Hz Range [4000.0f .. 16000.0f] Default: 6000.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EaxReverbDensity
member.summary: Reverb Modal Density controls the coloration of the late reverb. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EaxReverbDiffusion
member.summary: The Reverb Diffusion property controls the echo density in the reverberation decay. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EaxReverbGain
member.summary: Reverb Gain controls the level of the reverberant sound in an environment. A high level of reverb is characteristic of rooms with highly reflective walls and/or small dimensions. Unit: Linear gain Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.32f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EaxReverbGainHF
member.summary: Gain HF is used to attenuate the high frequency content of all the reflected sound in an environment. You can use this property to give a room specific spectral characteristic. Unit: Linear gain Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.89f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EaxReverbGainLF
member.summary: Gain LF is the low frequency counterpart to Gain HF. Use this to reduce or boost the low frequency content in an environment. Unit: Linear gain Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EaxReverbDecayTime
member.summary: The Decay Time property sets the reverberation decay time. It ranges from 0.1f (typically a small room with very dead surfaces) to 20.0f (typically a large room with very live surfaces). Unit: Seconds Range [0.1f .. 20.0f] Default: 1.49f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EaxReverbDecayHFRatio
member.summary: Decay HF Ratio scales the decay time of high frequencies relative to the value of the Decay Time property. By changing this value, you are changing the amount of time it takes for the high frequencies to decay compared to the mid frequencies of the reverb. Range [0.1f .. 2.0f] Default: 0.83f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EaxReverbDecayLFRatio
member.summary: Decay LF Ratio scales the decay time of low frequencies in the reverberation in the same manner that Decay HF Ratio handles high frequencies. Unit: Linear multiplier Range [0.1f .. 2.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EaxReverbReflectionsGain
member.summary: Reflections Gain sets the level of the early reflections in an environment. Early reflections are used as a cue for determining the size of the environment we are in. Unit: Linear gain Range [0.0f .. 3.16f] Default: 0.05f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EaxReverbReflectionsDelay
member.summary: Reflections Delay controls the amount of time it takes for the first reflected wave front to reach the listener, relative to the arrival of the direct-path sound. Unit: Seconds Range [0.0f .. 0.3f] Default: 0.007f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EaxReverbLateReverbGain
member.summary: The Late Reverb Gain property controls the overall amount of later reverberation relative to the Gain property. Range [0.0f .. 10.0f] Default: 1.26f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EaxReverbLateReverbDelay
member.summary: The Late Reverb Delay property defines the begin time of the late reverberation relative to the time of the initial reflection (the first of the early reflections). It ranges from 0 to 100 milliseconds. Unit: Seconds Range [0.0f .. 0.1f] Default: 0.011f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EaxReverbEchoTime
member.summary: Echo Time controls the rate at which the cyclic echo repeats itself along the reverberation decay. Range [0.075f .. 0.25f] Default: 0.25f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EaxReverbEchoDepth
member.summary: Echo Depth introduces a cyclic echo in the reverberation decay, which will be noticeable with transient or percussive sounds. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EaxReverbModulationTime
member.summary: Modulation Time controls the speed of the rate of periodic changes in pitch (vibrato). Range [0.04f .. 4.0f] Default: 0.25f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EaxReverbModulationDepth
member.summary: Modulation Depth controls the amount of pitch change. Low values of Diffusion will contribute to reinforcing the perceived effect by reducing the mixing of overlapping reflections in the reverberation decay. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EaxReverbAirAbsorptionGainHF
member.summary: The Air Absorption Gain HF property controls the distance-dependent attenuation at high frequencies caused by the propagation medium. It applies to reflected sound only. Range [0.892f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.994f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EaxReverbHFReference
member.summary: The property HF reference determines the frequency at which the high-frequency effects created by Reverb properties are measured. Unit: Hz Range [1000.0f .. 20000.0f] Default: 5000.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EaxReverbLFReference
member.summary: The property LF reference determines the frequency at which the low-frequency effects created by Reverb properties are measured. Unit: Hz Range [20.0f .. 1000.0f] Default: 250.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectFloat.EaxReverbRoomRolloffFactor
member.summary: The Room Rolloff Factor property is one of two methods available to attenuate the reflected sound (containing both reflections and reverberation) according to source-listener distance. It's defined the same way as OpenAL Rolloff Factor, but operates on reverb sound instead of direct-path sound. Range [0.0f .. 10.0f] Default: 0.0f

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectInteger
member.summary: A list of valid Int32 Effect/GetEffect parameters.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectInteger.ChorusWaveform
member.summary: This property sets the waveform shape of the low-frequency oscillator that controls the delay time of the delayed signals. Unit: (0) Sinusoid, (1) Triangle Range [0 .. 1] Default: 1

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectInteger.ChorusPhase
member.summary: This property controls the phase difference between the left and right low-frequency oscillators. At zero degrees the two low-frequency oscillators are synchronized. Unit: Degrees Range [-180 .. 180] Default: 90

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectInteger.FlangerWaveform
member.summary: Selects the shape of the low-frequency oscillator waveform that controls the amount of the delay of the sampled signal. Unit: (0) Sinusoid, (1) Triangle Range [0 .. 1] Default: 1

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectInteger.FlangerPhase
member.summary: This changes the phase difference between the left and right low-frequency oscillator's. At zero degrees the two low-frequency oscillators are synchronized. Range [-180 .. +180] Default: 0

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectInteger.FrequencyShifterLeftDirection
member.summary: These select which internal signals are added together to produce the output. Unit: (0) Down, (1) Up, (2) Off Range [0 .. 2] Default: 0

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectInteger.FrequencyShifterRightDirection
member.summary: These select which internal signals are added together to produce the output. Unit: (0) Down, (1) Up, (2) Off Range [0 .. 2] Default: 0

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectInteger.VocalMorpherPhonemeA
member.summary: Sets the vocal morpher 4-band formant filter A, used to impose vocal tract effects upon the input signal. The vocal morpher is not necessarily intended for use on voice signals; it is primarily intended for pitched noise effects, vocal-like wind effects, etc. Unit: Use enum EfxFormantFilterSettings Range [0 .. 29] Default: 0, "Phoneme A"

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectInteger.VocalMorpherPhonemeACoarseTuning
member.summary: This is used to adjust the pitch of phoneme filter A in 1-semitone increments. Unit: Semitones Range [-24 .. +24] Default: 0

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectInteger.VocalMorpherPhonemeB
member.summary: Sets the vocal morpher 4-band formant filter B, used to impose vocal tract effects upon the input signal. The vocal morpher is not necessarily intended for use on voice signals; it is primarily intended for pitched noise effects, vocal-like wind effects, etc. Unit: Use enum EfxFormantFilterSettings Range [0 .. 29] Default: 10, "Phoneme ER"

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectInteger.VocalMorpherPhonemeBCoarseTuning
member.summary: This is used to adjust the pitch of phoneme filter B in 1-semitone increments. Unit: Semitones Range [-24 .. +24] Default: 0

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectInteger.VocalMorpherWaveform
member.summary: This controls the shape of the low-frequency oscillator used to morph between the two phoneme filters. Unit: (0) Sinusoid, (1) Triangle, (2) Sawtooth Range [0 .. 2] Default: 0

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectInteger.PitchShifterCoarseTune
member.summary: This sets the number of semitones by which the pitch is shifted. There are 12 semitones per octave. Unit: Semitones Range [-12 .. +12] Default: +12

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectInteger.PitchShifterFineTune
member.summary: This sets the number of cents between Semitones a pitch is shifted. A Cent is 1/100th of a Semitone. Unit: Cents Range [-50 .. +50] Default: 0

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectInteger.RingModulatorWaveform
member.summary: This controls which waveform is used as the carrier signal. Traditional ring modulator and tremolo effects generally use a sinusoidal carrier. Unit: (0) Sinusoid, (1) Sawtooth, (2) Square Range [0 .. 2] Default: 0

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectInteger.CompressorOnoff
member.summary: Enabling this will result in audio exhibiting smaller variation in intensity between the loudest and quietest portions. Unit: (0) Off, (1) On Range [0 .. 1] Default: 1

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectInteger.ReverbDecayHFLimit
member.summary: When this flag is set, the high-frequency decay time automatically stays below a limit value that's derived from the setting of the property Air Absorption HF. Unit: (0) False, (1) True Range [False, True] Default: True

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectInteger.EaxReverbDecayHFLimit
member.summary: When this flag is set, the high-frequency decay time automatically stays below a limit value that's derived from the setting of the property AirAbsorptionGainHF. Unit: (0) False, (1) True Range [False, True] Default: True

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectInteger.EffectType
member.summary: Used with the enum EfxEffectType as it's parameter.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectSlotFloat
member.summary: A list of valid AuxiliaryEffectSlot/GetAuxiliaryEffectSlot parameters.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectSlotFloat.Gain
member.summary:
Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 1.0f
This property is used to specify an output level for the Auxiliary Effect Slot. Setting the gain to 0.0f mutes the output.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectSlotInteger
member.summary: A list of valid AuxiliaryEffectSlot/GetAuxiliaryEffectSlot parameters.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectSlotInteger.Effect
member.summary: This property is used to attach an Effect object to the Auxiliary Effect Slot object. After the attachment, the Auxiliary Effect Slot object will contain the effect type and have the same effect parameters that were stored in the Effect object. Any Sources feeding the Auxiliary Effect Slot will immediate feed the new effect type and new effect parameters.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectSlotInteger.AuxiliarySendAuto
member.summary: This property is used to enable or disable automatic send adjustments based on the physical positions of the sources and the listener. This property should be enabled when an application wishes to use a reverb effect to simulate the environment surrounding a listener or a collection of Sources.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectType
member.summary: Effect type definitions to be used with EfxEffecti.EffectType.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectType.Null
member.summary: No Effect, disable. This Effect type is used when an Effect object is initially created.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectType.Reverb
member.summary: The Reverb effect is the standard Effects Extension's environmental reverberation effect. It is available on all Generic Software and Generic Hardware devices.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectType.Chorus
member.summary: The Chorus effect essentially replays the input audio accompanied by another slightly delayed version of the signal, creating a "doubling" effect.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectType.Distortion
member.summary: The Distortion effect simulates turning up (overdriving) the gain stage on a guitar amplifier or adding a distortion pedal to an instrument's output.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectType.Echo
member.summary: The Echo effect generates discrete, delayed instances of the input signal.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectType.Flanger
member.summary: The Flanger effect creates a "tearing" or "whooshing" sound, like a jet flying overhead.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectType.FrequencyShifter
member.summary: The Frequency shifter is a single-sideband modulator, which translates all the component frequencies of the input signal by an equal amount.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectType.VocalMorpher
member.summary: The Vocal morpher consists of a pair of 4-band formant filters, used to impose vocal tract effects upon the input signal.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectType.PitchShifter
member.summary: The Pitch shifter applies time-invariant pitch shifting to the input signal, over a one octave range and controllable at a semi-tone and cent resolution.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectType.RingModulator
member.summary: The Ring modulator multiplies an input signal by a carrier signal in the time domain, resulting in tremolo or inharmonic effects.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectType.Autowah
member.summary: The Auto-wah effect emulates the sound of a wah-wah pedal used with an electric guitar, or a mute on a brass instrument.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectType.Compressor
member.summary: The Compressor will boost quieter portions of the audio, while louder portions will stay the same or may even be reduced.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectType.Equalizer
member.summary: The Equalizer is very flexible, providing tonal control over four different adjustable frequency ranges.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectType.EaxReverb
member.summary: The EAX Reverb has a more advanced parameter set than EfxEffectType.Reverb, but is only natively supported on devices that support the EAX 3.0 or above.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectVector3
member.summary: A list of valid Math.Vector3 Effect/GetEffect parameters.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectVector3.EaxReverbLateReverbPan
member.summary: Reverb Pan does for the Reverb what Reflections Pan does for the Reflections. Unit: Vector3 of length 0f to 1f Default: {0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f}

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EffectVector3.EaxReverbReflectionsPan
member.summary: This Vector3 controls the spatial distribution of the cluster of early reflections. The direction of this vector controls the global direction of the reflections, while its magnitude controls how focused the reflections are towards this direction. For legacy reasons this Vector3 follows a left-handed co-ordinate system! Note that OpenAL uses a right-handed coordinate system. Unit: Vector3 of length 0f to 1f Default: {0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f}

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EFXContextAttributes
member.summary: Defines new context attributes.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EFXContextAttributes.MaxAuxiliarySends
member.summary:
Default: 2
This Context property can be passed to OpenAL during Context creation (alcCreateContext) to request a maximum number of Auxiliary Sends desired on each Source. It is not guaranteed that the desired number of sends will be available, so an application should query this property after creating the context using alcGetIntergerv.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EFXContextInteger
member.summary: Defines new integer properties on the OpenAL context.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EFXContextInteger.EFXMajorVersion
member.summary: This property can be used by the application to retrieve the Major version number of the Effects Extension supported by this OpenAL implementation. As this is a Context property is should be retrieved using alcGetIntegerv.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EFXContextInteger.EFXMinorVersion
member.summary: This property can be used by the application to retrieve the Minor version number of the Effects Extension supported by this OpenAL implementation. As this is a Context property is should be retrieved using alcGetIntegerv.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EFXContextInteger.MaxAuxiliarySends
member.summary:
Default: 2
This Context property can be passed to OpenAL during Context creation (alcCreateContext) to request a maximum number of Auxiliary Sends desired on each Source. It is not guaranteed that the desired number of sends will be available, so an application should query this property after creating the context using alcGetIntergerv.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EFXListenerFloat
member.summary: A list of valid Listener/GetListener parameters.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EFXListenerFloat.EfxMetersPerUnit
member.summary:
centimeters 0.01f meters 1.0f kilometers 1000.0f Range [float.MinValue .. float.MaxValue] Default: 1.0f.
This setting is critical if Air Absorption effects are enabled because the amount of Air Absorption applied is directly related to the real-world distance between the Source and the Listener.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EFXSourceBoolean
member.summary: A list of valid Source/GetSource parameters.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EFXSourceBoolean.DirectFilterGainHighFrequencyAuto
member.summary:
Default: True
If this Source property is set to True, this Sources direct-path is automatically filtered according to the orientation of the source relative to the listener and the setting of the Source property Sourcef.ConeOuterGainHF.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EFXSourceBoolean.AuxiliarySendFilterGainAuto
member.summary:
Default: True
If this Source property is set to True, the intensity of this Sources reflected sound is automatically attenuated according to source-listener distance and source directivity (as determined by the cone parameters). If it is False, the reflected sound is not attenuated according to distance and directivity.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EFXSourceBoolean.AuxiliarySendFilterGainHighFrequencyAuto
member.summary:
Default: True
If this Source property is AL_TRUE (its default value), the intensity of this Sources reflected sound at high frequencies will be automatically attenuated according to the high-frequency source directivity as set by the Sourcef.ConeOuterGainHF property. If this property is AL_FALSE, the Sources reflected sound is not filtered at all according to the Sources directivity.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EFXSourceFloat
member.summary: A list of valid Source/GetSource parameters.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EFXSourceFloat.AirAbsorptionFactor
member.summary:
Range [0.0f .. 10.0f] Default: 0.0f
This property is a multiplier on the amount of Air Absorption applied to the Source. The AL_AIR_ABSORPTION_FACTOR is multiplied by an internal Air Absorption Gain HF value of 0.994 (-0.05dB) per meter which represents normal atmospheric humidity and temperature.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EFXSourceFloat.RoomRolloffFactor
member.summary:
Range [0.0f .. 10.0f] Default: 0.0f
This property is defined the same way as the Reverb Room Rolloff property: it is one of two methods available in the Effect Extension to attenuate the reflected sound (early reflections and reverberation) according to source-listener distance.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EFXSourceFloat.ConeOuterGainHighFrequency
member.summary:
Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 1.0f
A directed Source points in a specified direction. The Source sounds at full volume when the listener is directly in front of the source; it is attenuated as the listener circles the Source away from the front.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EFXSourceInteger
member.summary: A list of valid Source/GetSource parameters.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EFXSourceInteger.DirectFilter
member.summary: This Source property is used to apply filtering on the direct-path (dry signal) of a Source.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EFXSourceInteger3
member.summary: A list of valid Source/GetSource parameters.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.EFXSourceInteger3.AuxiliarySendFilter
member.summary: This Source property is used to establish connections between Sources and Auxiliary Effect Slots. For a Source to feed an Effect that has been loaded into an Auxiliary Effect Slot the application must configure one of the Sources auxiliary sends. This process involves setting 3 variables the destination Auxiliary Effect Slot ID, the Auxiliary Send number, and an optional Filter ID.

member.summary: Filter type definitions to be used with EfxFilteri.FilterType.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.FilterType.Null
member.summary: No Filter, disable. This Filter type is used when a Filter object is initially created.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.FilterType.Lowpass
member.summary: A low-pass filter is used to remove high frequency content from a signal.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.FilterType.Highpass
member.summary: Currently not implemented. A high-pass filter is used to remove low frequency content from a signal.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.FilterType.Bandpass
member.summary: Currently not implemented. A band-pass filter is used to remove high and low frequency content from a signal.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.Creative.EFX.FormantFilterSettings
member.summary: Vocal morpher effect parameters. If both parameters are set to the same phoneme, that determines the filtering effect that will be heard. If these two parameters are set to different phonemes, the filtering effect will morph between the two settings at a rate specified by EfxEffectf.VocalMorpherRate.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.SOFT.DeviceClock.GetInteger64.DeviceClock
member.summary: The audio device clock time, expressed in nanoseconds. NULL is an invalid device. ALC_DEVICE_CLOCK_SOFT

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.SOFT.DeviceClock.GetInteger64.DeviceLatency
member.summary: The current audio device latency, in nanoseconds. This is effectively the delay for the samples rendered at the the device's current clock time from reaching the physical output. NULL is an invalid device. ALC_DEVICE_LATENCY_SOFT

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.SOFT.DeviceClock.GetInteger64.DeviceClockLatency
member.summary: Expects a destination size of 2, and provides both the audio device clock time and latency, both in nanoseconds. The two values are measured atomically with respect to one another (i.e. the latency value was measured at the same time the device clock value was retrieved). NULL is an invalid device. ALC_DEVICE_CLOCK_LATENCY_SOFT

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.SOFT.DeviceClock.SourceDouble.SecOffsetClock
member.summary:
AL_SEC_OFFSET_LATENCY_SOFT
The playback position, along with the device clock, both expressed in seconds. This attribute is read-only.
The first value in the returned vector is the offset in seconds. The value is similar to that returned by , just with more precision.
The second value is the device clock, in seconds. This updates at the same rate as the offset, and both are measured atomically with respect to one another. Be aware that this value may be subtly different from the other device clock queries due to the variable precision of floating-point values.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.SOFT.DeviceClock.SourceInteger64.SampleOffsetClock
member.summary:
AL_SAMPLE_OFFSET_CLOCK_SOFT
The playback position, expressed in fixed-point samples, along with the device clock, expressed in nanoseconds. This attribute is read-only.
The first value in the returned vector is the sample offset, which is a 32.32 fixed-point value. The whole number is stored in the upper 32 bits and the fractional component is in the lower 32 bits. The value is similar to that returned by , just with more precision.
The second value is the device clock, in nanoseconds. This updates at the same rate as the offset, and both are measured atomically with respect to one another.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.SOFT.SourceLatency.SourceLatencyVector2i.SampleOffsetLatency
member.summary: The playback position, expressed in fixed-point samples, along with the playback latency, expressed in nanoseconds (1/1000000000ths of a second). This attribute is read-only. AL_SAMPLE_OFFSET_LATENCY_SOFT

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Extensions.SOFT.SourceLatency.SourceLatencyVector2d.SecOffsetLatency
member.summary: The playback position, along with the playback latency, both expressed in seconds. This attribute is read-only. AL_SEC_OFFSET_LATENCY_SOFT
